UML:TaggedValue.value:
A package to allow delivering EarthResourceML in a Simple Feature Level 0 format. All cardinalities are 0 to 1, all data types are strings, integers, numbers or anyURI.
Little attempt is made to enforce content standards and relational information is kept to a minimum. This package is designed to allow ready import into simple clients such as GIS and spreadsheet tools.
The package also provides a format for delivering responses to WMS queries.
Class to specify a simple view of an EarthResource feature for use in Web Mapping Service GetFeatureRequest responses or GML3.1 Simple Feature Level 0 Web Feature Services
A URI to identify the major commodity found at the EarthResource to allow thematic mapping of commodities
The major commodity found at the EarthResource. String values allows concatanation of multiple commodities if required (Cu, Au, Pb).
A URI to identify the EarthResource to allow obtaining more complete information about the EarthResource
The major commodity found at the EarthResource. String values allows concatanation of multiple commodities if required (Cu, Au, Pb).
Identifier to allow creating thematic maps based on the MineralDepositModelLabel property.

Simple label to classify the EarthResource Systematically arranged information describing the essential attributes of a class of mineral deposits. May be empirical (descriptive) or theoretical (genetic).
The major commodity found at the EarthResource. String values allows concatanation of multiple commodities if required (Cu, Au, Pb).
The typical geometrical shape of the Earth Resource (e.g. lenticular, pipelike, irregular etc)

Endowment refers to that quantity of a mineral in accumulations (deposits) meeting specified physical characteristics such as quality, size and depth. Usually includes Resources, as unlike the latter, it does not have to have prospects for "eventual economic extraction". It often includes the total amount of a commodity originally introduced to a particular location during the deposit forming processes - and thus can include resources, reserves, past production and mining and metallurgical losses. String datatype so units of measure can be included in value
Amount of ore. String datatype so units of measure can be included in value

The economically mineable part of a Measured and/or Indicated Mineral Resource. It includes diluting materials and allowances for losses, which may occur when the material is mined. ‘Marketable Coal Reserves’ maybe reported in conjunction with, but not instead of, reports of Ore (Coal) Reserves. ‘Saleable product’ (e.g. for industrial minerals) can be reported in conjunction with ore reserve. Synonyms: Ore Reserve; Coal Reserve (s); Diamond (or gemstone) Ore Reserve; Mineral Reserves (not preferred, should be stated that used to mean the same as JORC’s Ore Reserve); Mineable production estimates. String datatype so units of measure can be included in value

A concentration or occurrence of material of intrinsic economic interest in or on the Earth’s crust in such form, quality and quantity that there are reasonable prospects for eventual economic extraction. String datatype so units of measure can be included in value Synonyms: Mineral Resource; Coal Resource (s); Diamond (Gemstone) Resource; Potentially Mineable Mineralisation
Captures the type of mineral occurrence. Examples are prospect, occurrence, mineral deposit, ore deposit, field, district, lode.
Class to specify a simple view of a MiningActivity feature for use in Web Mapping Service GetFeatureRequest responses or GML3.1 Simple Feature Level 0 Web Feature Services
The end date of the MiningActivity
The start time of the MiningActivity
The type of mining activity (eg Open Cut, Underground Mine, multiple, unspecified) or processing activity (eg Ore Processing) or production.
A URI to identify the Mine associated with the MiningActivity to obtain the complete Mine data
Preferred name of the Mine associated with the MiningActivity
A URI to identify the Mine associated with the MiningActivity to obtain the complete Mine data
A URI to identify the major commodity associated with the MiningActivity to allow thematic mapping of commodities
The major commodity found at the MiningActivity
A URI to identify the Mine associated with the MiningActivity to obtain the complete Mine data
The amount of ore processed by the MiningActivity String datatype so units of measure can be included in value
Quantity of product produced during the MiningActivity String datatype so units of measure can be included in value
The relative quantity or percentage of ore mineral content in an orebody. (Could be Feed Grade, ore grade) String datatype so units of measure can be included in value

The percentage of valuable constituent derived from an ore, or of coal from a coal seam; a measure of mining or extraction efficency. (Recovery rate is usually expressed as a percent). String datatype so units of measure can be included in value
Abstract class to contain package that specify a simple view of EarthResourceML packages for use in Web Mapping Service GetFeatureRequest responses

Simple label for the method that was used to identify the location of the feature. Examples: digitised, Global Positioning System, published map, field Observation, downhole survey, aerial photography, field survey. This corresponds (loosely) to ISO19115 Lineage.Statement

Simple label for the accuracy of the feature location. Examples: accurate, approximate, diagramatic, indefinite, unknown, 5 m. Corresponds to ISO19115 DQ_ThematicAccuracy (either quantitative or non quantitative).result .value.
Class to specify a simple view of a Mine feature for use in Web Mapping Service GetFeatureRequest responses or GML3.1 Simple Feature Level 0 Web Feature Services
Operational status (eg Care & Maintenance, Pending Approval, operating continually)
